pokecraft.species.kadabra.desc: There are rumors that a child with mystical powers became a Kadabra; however, this remains unverified. I suspect that the spoon Kadabra holds enhances its brain waves.
pokecraft.species.kadabra.name: Kadabra
pokecraft.species.kakuna.desc: Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
pokecraft.species.kakuna.name: Kakuna
pokecraft.species.kangaskhan.desc: There are records of a lost human child being raised by a childless Kangaskhan.
pokecraft.species.kangaskhan.name: Kangaskhan
pokecraft.species.karrablast.desc: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
pokecraft.species.karrablast.name: Karrablast
pokecraft.species.kartana.desc: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokecraft.species.kartana.name: Kartana
pokecraft.species.kecleon.desc: Its color changes for concealment and also when its mood or health changes. The darker the color, the healthier it is.
pokecraft.species.kecleon.name: Kecleon
pokecraft.species.keldeo.desc: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.
pokecraft.species.keldeo.name: Keldeo
pokecraft.species.kingdra.desc: Scales shed by this Pokémon have such a splendorous gleam to them that they’ve been given to royalty as gifts.
pokecraft.species.kingdra.name: Kingdra
pokecraft.species.kingler.desc: Its oversized claw is very powerful, but when it’s not in battle, the claw just gets in the way.
pokecraft.species.kingler.name: Kingler
pokecraft.species.kirlia.desc: It resembles a maiden in appearance, but it wields strange powers to project visions of paradise. I suspect the crimson ornaments on its head are the key to its abilities.
pokecraft.species.kirlia.name: Kirlia
pokecraft.species.klang.desc: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
pokecraft.species.klang.name: Klang
pokecraft.species.kleavor.desc: A violent creature that fells towering trees with its crude axes and shields itself with hard stone. If one should chance upon this Pokémon in the wilds, one's only recourse is to flee.
pokecraft.species.kleavor.name: Kleavor
pokecraft.species.klefki.desc: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
pokecraft.species.klefki.name: Klefki
pokecraft.species.klink.desc: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.
pokecraft.species.klink.name: Klink
pokecraft.species.klinklang.desc: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.
pokecraft.species.klinklang.name: Klinklang
pokecraft.species.koffing.desc: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.
pokecraft.species.koffing.name: Koffing
pokecraft.species.komala.desc: It remains asleep from birth to death as a result of the sedative properties of the leaves that form its diet.
pokecraft.species.komala.name: Komala
pokecraft.species.kommoo.desc: Certain ruins have paintings of ancient warriors wearing armor made of Kommo-o scales.
pokecraft.species.kommoo.name: Kommo-o
pokecraft.species.krabby.desc: If it senses danger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.
pokecraft.species.krabby.name: Krabby
pokecraft.species.kricketot.desc: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
pokecraft.species.kricketot.name: Kricketot
pokecraft.species.kricketune.desc: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
pokecraft.species.kricketune.name: Kricketune
pokecraft.species.krokorok.desc: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
pokecraft.species.krokorok.name: Krokorok
pokecraft.species.krookodile.desc: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
pokecraft.species.krookodile.name: Krookodile
pokecraft.species.kubfu.desc: If Kubfu pulls the long white hair on its head, its fighting spirit heightens and power wells up from the depths of its belly.
pokecraft.species.kubfu.name: Kubfu
pokecraft.species.kyogre.desc: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
pokecraft.species.kyogre.name: Kyogre
pokecraft.species.kyurem.desc: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
pokecraft.species.kyurem.name: Kyurem
pokecraft.species.lairon.desc: During territorial disputes, Lairon fight by slamming into each other. Close inspection of their steel armor reveals scratches and dents.
pokecraft.species.lairon.name: Lairon
pokecraft.species.lampent.desc: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
pokecraft.species.lampent.name: Lampent
pokecraft.species.landorus.desc: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.
pokecraft.species.landorus.name: Landorus
pokecraft.species.lanturn.desc: This Pokémon flashes a bright light that blinds its prey. This creates an opening for it to deliver an electrical attack.
pokecraft.species.lanturn.name: Lanturn
pokecraft.species.lapras.desc: Crossing icy seas is no issue for this cold-resistant Pokémon. Its smooth skin is a little cool to the touch.
pokecraft.species.lapras.name: Lapras
pokecraft.species.larvesta.desc: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
pokecraft.species.larvesta.name: Larvesta
pokecraft.species.larvitar.desc: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.
pokecraft.species.larvitar.name: Larvitar
pokecraft.species.latias.desc: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
pokecraft.species.latias.name: Latias
pokecraft.species.latios.desc: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
pokecraft.species.latios.name: Latios
pokecraft.species.leafeon.desc: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
pokecraft.species.leafeon.name: Leafeon
pokecraft.species.leavanny.desc: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
pokecraft.species.leavanny.name: Leavanny
pokecraft.species.lechonk.name: Lechonk
pokecraft.species.ledian.desc: It flies through the night sky, sprinkling sparkly dust. According to some, if that dust sticks to you, good things will happen to you.
pokecraft.species.ledian.name: Ledian
pokecraft.species.ledyba.desc: These very cowardly Pokémon join together and use Reflect to protect their nest.
pokecraft.species.ledyba.name: Ledyba
pokecraft.species.lickilicky.desc: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
pokecraft.species.lickilicky.name: Lickilicky
pokecraft.species.lickitung.desc: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.
pokecraft.species.lickitung.name: Lickitung
pokecraft.species.liepard.desc: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
pokecraft.species.liepard.name: Liepard
pokecraft.species.lileep.desc: Lileep clings to rocks on the seabed. When prey comes close, this Pokémon entangles it with petallike tentacles.
pokecraft.species.lileep.name: Lileep
pokecraft.species.lilligant.desc: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
pokecraft.species.lilligant.name: Lilligant
pokecraft.species.lillipup.desc: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
pokecraft.species.lillipup.name: Lillipup
pokecraft.species.linoone.desc: It uses its explosive speed and razor-sharp claws to bring down prey. Running along winding paths is not its strong suit.
pokecraft.species.linoone.name: Linoone
pokecraft.species.litleo.desc: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.
pokecraft.species.litleo.name: Litleo
pokecraft.species.litten.desc: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
pokecraft.species.litten.name: Litten
pokecraft.species.litwick.desc: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
pokecraft.species.litwick.name: Litwick
pokecraft.species.lombre.desc: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.
pokecraft.species.lombre.name: Lombre
pokecraft.species.lopunny.desc: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
pokecraft.species.lopunny.name: Lopunny
pokecraft.species.lotad.desc: Its leaf grew too large for it to live on land. That is how it began to live floating in the water.
pokecraft.species.lotad.name: Lotad
pokecraft.species.loudred.desc: The force of this Pokémon’s loud voice isn’t just the sound—it’s also the wave of air pressure that blows opponents away and damages them.
pokecraft.species.loudred.name: Loudred
pokecraft.species.lucario.desc: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.
pokecraft.species.lucario.name: Lucario
pokecraft.species.ludicolo.desc: If it hears festive music, it begins moving in rhythm in order to amplify its power.
pokecraft.species.ludicolo.name: Ludicolo
pokecraft.species.lugia.desc: Lugia’s wings pack devastating power—a light fluttering of its wings can blow apart regular houses. As a result, this Pokémon chooses to live out of sight deep under the sea.
pokecraft.species.lugia.name: Lugia
pokecraft.species.lumineon.desc: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.
pokecraft.species.lumineon.name: Lumineon
pokecraft.species.lunala.desc: It steals the light from its surroundings and then becomes the full moon, showering its own light across the night sky.
pokecraft.species.lunala.name: Lunala
pokecraft.species.lunatone.desc: It was discovered at the site of a meteor strike 40 years ago. Its stare can lull its foes to sleep.
pokecraft.species.lunatone.name: Lunatone
pokecraft.species.lurantis.desc: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
pokecraft.species.lurantis.name: Lurantis
pokecraft.species.luvdisc.desc: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola’s branches.
pokecraft.species.luvdisc.name: Luvdisc
pokecraft.species.luxio.desc: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
pokecraft.species.luxio.name: Luxio
pokecraft.species.luxray.desc: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.
pokecraft.species.luxray.name: Luxray
pokecraft.species.lycanroc.desc: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
pokecraft.species.lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
pokecraft.species.machamp.desc: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.
pokecraft.species.machamp.name: Machamp
pokecraft.species.machoke.desc: A sturdy creature boasting a robust physique and boundless stamina. Loves training above all else and voluntarily assists with tasks such as construction and clearing land.
pokecraft.species.machoke.name: Machoke
pokecraft.species.machop.desc: Though as small as a child, it has strength enough to easily throw a well-built adult. Striving to become ever stronger, Machop trains by carrying a Graveler on its shoulders.
pokecraft.species.machop.name: Machop
pokecraft.species.magby.desc: This Pokémon lives in volcanic areas. With each breath, sparks spurt from its mouth and nose. When Magby is in good health, its flames gain a yellow tint.
pokecraft.species.magby.name: Magby
pokecraft.species.magcargo.desc: Magcargo’s body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
pokecraft.species.magcargo.name: Magcargo
pokecraft.species.magearna.desc: Built roughly 500 years ago by a scientist, the part called the Soul-Heart is the actual life-form.
pokecraft.species.magearna.name: Magearna
pokecraft.species.magikarp.desc: A feeble, pitiful imbecile of a Pokémon that is nonetheless very hardy. Unperturbed by turbid water, it can be found living in all sorts of places.
pokecraft.species.magikarp.name: Magikarp
pokecraft.species.magmar.desc: Legend has it that this Pokémon was born from the crater of a volcano. When wounded, it bathes in lava to heal its body, much as one would soak in a hot spring.
pokecraft.species.magmar.name: Magmar
pokecraft.species.magmortar.desc: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
pokecraft.species.magmortar.name: Magmortar
pokecraft.species.magnemite.desc: A bizarre Pokémon with but a single eye embedded in an iron sphere. I suspect this creature levitates due to the magnetism it emits from its arms, which resemble horseshoe-shaped magnets.
pokecraft.species.magnemite.name: Magnemite
pokecraft.species.magneton.desc: Three Magnemite gathered to evolve into this Pokémon. The source of much vexation on my part, as its powerful magnetism destroys my research equipment.
pokecraft.species.magneton.name: Magneton
pokecraft.species.magnezone.desc: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
pokecraft.species.magnezone.name: Magnezone
pokecraft.species.makuhita.desc: There’s a rumor of a traditional recipe for stew that Trainers can use to raise strong Makuhita.
pokecraft.species.makuhita.name: Makuhita
pokecraft.species.malamar.desc: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
pokecraft.species.malamar.name: Malamar
pokecraft.species.mamoswine.desc: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
pokecraft.species.mamoswine.name: Mamoswine
pokecraft.species.manaphy.desc: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
pokecraft.species.manaphy.name: Manaphy
pokecraft.species.mandibuzz.desc: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
pokecraft.species.mandibuzz.name: Mandibuzz
pokecraft.species.manectric.desc: It rarely appears before people. It is said to nest where lightning has fallen.
pokecraft.species.manectric.name: Manectric
pokecraft.species.mankey.desc: An agile Pokémon that lives in trees. It angers easily and will not hesitate to attack anything.
pokecraft.species.mankey.name: Mankey
pokecraft.species.mantine.desc: This calm and gentle Pokémon swims gracefully through the sea. After building speed, it can leap out of the water. It is often misidentified as a bird Pokémon due to this behavior.
pokecraft.species.mantine.name: Mantine
pokecraft.species.mantyke.desc: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
pokecraft.species.mantyke.name: Mantyke
pokecraft.species.maractus.desc: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
pokecraft.species.maractus.name: Maractus
pokecraft.species.mareanie.desc: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
pokecraft.species.mareanie.name: Mareanie
pokecraft.species.mareep.desc: Rubbing its fleece generates electricity. You’ll want to pet it because it’s cute, but if you use your bare hand, you’ll get a painful shock.
pokecraft.species.mareep.name: Mareep
pokecraft.species.marill.desc: Even after Marill swims in a cold sea, its water- repellent fur dries almost as soon as Marill leaves the water. That’s why this Pokémon is never cold.
pokecraft.species.marill.name: Marill
pokecraft.species.marowak.desc: When this Pokémon evolved, the skull of its mother fused to it. Marowak’s temperament also turned vicious at the same time.
pokecraft.species.marowak.name: Marowak
pokecraft.species.marshadow.desc: This Pokémon can conceal itself in any shadow, so it went undiscovered for a long time.
pokecraft.species.marshadow.name: Marshadow
pokecraft.species.marshtomp.desc: Marshtomp is much faster at traveling through mud than it is at swimming. This Pokémon’s hindquarters exhibit obvious development, giving it the ability to walk on just its hind legs.
pokecraft.species.marshtomp.name: Marshtomp
pokecraft.species.masquerain.desc: Its thin, winglike antennae are highly absorbent. It waits out rainy days in tree hollows.
pokecraft.species.masquerain.name: Masquerain
pokecraft.species.mawile.desc: It chomps with its gaping mouth. Its huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed.
pokecraft.species.mawile.name: Mawile
pokecraft.species.medicham.desc: Through the power of meditation, Medicham developed its sixth sense. It gained the ability to use psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon is known to meditate for a whole month without eating.
pokecraft.species.medicham.name: Medicham
pokecraft.species.meditite.desc: Meditite heightens its inner energy through meditation. It survives on just one berry a day. Minimal eating is another aspect of this Pokémon’s training.
pokecraft.species.meditite.name: Meditite
pokecraft.species.meganium.desc: The fragrance of Meganium’s flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe’s fighting spirit.
pokecraft.species.meganium.name: Meganium
pokecraft.species.melmetal.desc: Centrifugal force is behind the punches of Melmetal’s heavy hex-nut arms. Melmetal is said to deliver the strongest punches of all Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.melmetal.name: Melmetal
pokecraft.species.meloetta.desc: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
pokecraft.species.meloetta.name: Meloetta
pokecraft.species.meltan.desc: They live as a group, but when the time comes, one strong Meltan will absorb all the others and evolve.
pokecraft.species.meltan.name: Meltan
pokecraft.species.meowscarada.name: Meowscarada
pokecraft.species.meowstic.desc: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
pokecraft.species.meowstic.name: Meowstic
pokecraft.species.meowth.desc: It loves to collect shiny things. If it’s in a good mood, it might even let its Trainer have a look at its hoard of treasures.
pokecraft.species.meowth.name: Meowth
pokecraft.species.mesprit.desc: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
pokecraft.species.mesprit.name: Mesprit
pokecraft.species.metagross.desc: Metagross is the result of the fusion of two Metang. This Pokémon defeats its opponents through use of its supercomputer-level brain.
pokecraft.species.metagross.name: Metagross
pokecraft.species.metang.desc: Using magnetic forces to stay aloft, this Pokémon flies at high speeds, weaving through harsh mountain terrain in pursuit of prey.
pokecraft.species.metang.name: Metang
pokecraft.species.metapod.desc: Even though it is encased in a sturdy shell, the body inside is tender. It can’t withstand a harsh attack.
pokecraft.species.metapod.name: Metapod
pokecraft.species.mew.desc: When viewed through a microscope, this Pokémon’s short, fine, delicate hair can be seen.
pokecraft.species.mew.name: Mew
pokecraft.species.mewtwo.desc: Its DNA is almost the same as Mew’s. However, its size and disposition are vastly different.
pokecraft.species.mewtwo.name: Mewtwo
pokecraft.species.mienfoo.desc: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
pokecraft.species.mienfoo.name: Mienfoo
pokecraft.species.mienshao.desc: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
pokecraft.species.mienshao.name: Mienshao
pokecraft.species.mightyena.desc: Mightyena travel and act as a pack in the wild. The memory of its life in the wild compels the Pokémon to obey only those Trainers that it recognizes to possess superior skill.
pokecraft.species.mightyena.name: Mightyena
pokecraft.species.milcery.desc: They say that any patisserie visited by Milcery is guaranteed success and good fortune.
pokecraft.species.milcery.name: Milcery
pokecraft.species.milotic.desc: It’s said that a glimpse of a Milotic and its beauty will calm any hostile emotions you’re feeling.
pokecraft.species.milotic.name: Milotic
pokecraft.species.miltank.desc: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
pokecraft.species.miltank.name: Miltank
pokecraft.species.mimejr.desc: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
pokecraft.species.mimejr.name: Mime Jr.
pokecraft.species.mimikyu.desc: There was a scientist who peeked under Mimikyu’s old rag in the name of research. The scientist died of a mysterious disease.
pokecraft.species.mimikyu.name: Mimikyu
pokecraft.species.minccino.desc: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
pokecraft.species.minccino.name: Minccino
pokecraft.species.minior.desc: Although its outer shell is uncommonly durable, the shock of falling to the ground smashes the shell to smithereens.
pokecraft.species.minior.name: Minior
pokecraft.species.minun.desc: Minun loves to cheer on its partner in battle. It gives off sparks from its body while it is doing so. If its partner is in trouble, this Pokémon gives off increasing amounts of sparks.
pokecraft.species.minun.name: Minun
pokecraft.species.misdreavus.desc: It conceals itself in darkness, sending chills up travelers' spines with its childlike weeping. As it observes the frightened travelers with glee, the red orbs upon its chest let off an eerie light.
pokecraft.species.misdreavus.name: Misdreavus
pokecraft.species.mismagius.desc: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
pokecraft.species.mismagius.name: Mismagius
pokecraft.species.moltres.desc: There are stories of this Pokémon using its radiant, flame-cloaked wings to light up paths for those lost in the mountains.
pokecraft.species.moltres.name: Moltres
pokecraft.species.monferno.desc: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
pokecraft.species.monferno.name: Monferno
pokecraft.species.morelull.desc: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
pokecraft.species.morelull.name: Morelull
pokecraft.species.morgrem.desc: With sly cunning, it tries to lure people into the woods. Some believe it to have the power to make crops grow.
pokecraft.species.morgrem.name: Morgrem
pokecraft.species.morpeko.desc: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
pokecraft.species.morpeko.name: Morpeko
pokecraft.species.mothim.desc: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
pokecraft.species.mothim.name: Mothim
pokecraft.species.mrmime.desc: The behavior of this clown-like Pokémon reminds one of pantomime. It creates invisible walls using a force emitted from its fingertips.
pokecraft.species.mrmime.name: Mr. Mime
pokecraft.species.mrrime.desc: Its amusing movements make it very popular. It releases its psychic power from the pattern on its belly.
pokecraft.species.mrrime.name: Mr. Rime
pokecraft.species.mudbray.desc: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
pokecraft.species.mudbray.name: Mudbray
pokecraft.species.mudkip.desc: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
pokecraft.species.mudkip.name: Mudkip
pokecraft.species.mudsdale.desc: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
pokecraft.species.mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
pokecraft.species.muk.desc: Smells so awful, it can cause fainting. Through degeneration of its nose, it lost its sense of smell.
pokecraft.species.muk.name: Muk
pokecraft.species.munchlax.desc: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
pokecraft.species.munchlax.name: Munchlax
pokecraft.species.munna.desc: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
pokecraft.species.munna.name: Munna
pokecraft.species.murkrow.desc: Widely shunned as a bearer of ill fortune. Upon crossing paths with this creature, I've been told one must chant ”Workrum, Workrum—bad luck, don't come” as a protective incantation.
pokecraft.species.murkrow.name: Murkrow
pokecraft.species.musharna.desc: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
pokecraft.species.musharna.name: Musharna
pokecraft.species.naganadel.desc: One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.
pokecraft.species.naganadel.name: Naganadel
pokecraft.species.natu.desc: Because its wings aren’t yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always staring at something.
pokecraft.species.natu.name: Natu
pokecraft.species.necrozma.desc: It needs light to survive, and it goes on a rampage seeking it out. Its laser beams will cut anything to pieces.
pokecraft.species.necrozma.name: Necrozma
pokecraft.species.nickit.desc: Cunning and cautious, this Pokémon survives by stealing food from others. It erases its tracks with swipes of its tail as it makes off with its plunder.
pokecraft.species.nickit.name: Nickit
pokecraft.species.nidoking.desc: Nidoking prides itself on its strength. It’s forceful and spirited in battle, making use of its thick tail and diamond-crushing horn.
pokecraft.species.nidoking.name: Nidoking
pokecraft.species.nidoqueen.desc: It pacifies offspring by placing them in the gaps between the spines on its back. The spines will never secrete poison while young are present.
pokecraft.species.nidoqueen.name: Nidoqueen
pokecraft.species.nidoranf.desc: It uses its hard incisor teeth to crush and eat berries. The tip of a female Nidoran’s horn is a bit more rounded than the tip of a male’s horn.
pokecraft.species.nidoranf.name: Nidoran♀
pokecraft.species.nidoranm.desc: Small but brave, this Pokémon will hold its ground and even risk its life in battle to protect the female it’s friendly with.
pokecraft.species.nidoranm.name: Nidoran♂
pokecraft.species.nidorina.desc: If the group is threatened, these Pokémon will band together to assault enemies with a chorus of ultrasonic waves.
pokecraft.species.nidorina.name: Nidorina
pokecraft.species.nidorino.desc: It’s nervous and quick to act aggressively. The potency of its poison increases along with the level of adrenaline present in its body.
pokecraft.species.nidorino.name: Nidorino
pokecraft.species.nihilego.desc: It appeared in this world from an Ultra Wormhole. Nihilego appears to be a parasite that lives by feeding on people and Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.nihilego.name: Nihilego
pokecraft.species.nincada.desc: It can sometimes live underground for more than 10 years. It absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees.
pokecraft.species.nincada.name: Nincada
pokecraft.species.ninetales.desc: The coat of gleaming golden fur is quite magnificent. This species is said to store sacred power in its nine long tails and to live for a millennium.
pokecraft.species.ninetales.name: Ninetales
pokecraft.species.ninjask.desc: This Pokémon is so quick, it is said to be able to avoid any attack. It loves to feed on tree sap.
pokecraft.species.ninjask.name: Ninjask
pokecraft.species.noctowl.desc: When it needs to think, it rotates its head 180 degrees to sharpen its intellectual power.
pokecraft.species.noctowl.name: Noctowl
pokecraft.species.noibat.desc: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.noibat.name: Noibat
pokecraft.species.noivern.desc: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
pokecraft.species.noivern.name: Noivern
pokecraft.species.nosepass.desc: Once the people of Hisui discovered that its red nose always points north, they grew to rely on it greatly when traveling afar. The nose seems to work in a similar way to ancient compasses.
pokecraft.species.nosepass.name: Nosepass
pokecraft.species.numel.desc: Numel stores magma of almost 2,200 degrees Fahrenheit within its body. If it gets wet, the magma cools and hardens. In that event, the Pokémon’s body grows heavy and its movements become sluggish.
pokecraft.species.numel.name: Numel
pokecraft.species.nuzleaf.desc: They live in holes bored in large trees. The sound of Nuzleaf’s grass flute fills listeners with dread.
pokecraft.species.nuzleaf.name: Nuzleaf
pokecraft.species.obstagoon.desc: It evolved after experiencing numerous fights. While crossing its arms, it lets out a shout that would make any opponent flinch.
pokecraft.species.obstagoon.name: Obstagoon
pokecraft.species.octillery.desc: While Octillery still shoots water from its mouth, the drastic anatomical difference between it and Remoraid meant that for a long time, no one believed the former evolved from the latter.
pokecraft.species.octillery.name: Octillery
pokecraft.species.oddish.desc: During the day, it stays in the cold underground to avoid the sun. It grows by bathing in moonlight.
pokecraft.species.oddish.name: Oddish
pokecraft.species.oinkologne.name: Oinkologne
pokecraft.species.omanyte.desc: This Pokémon is a member of an ancient, extinct species. Omanyte paddles through water with its 10 tentacles, looking like it’s just drifting along.
pokecraft.species.omanyte.name: Omanyte
pokecraft.species.omastar.desc: Omastar’s sharp fangs could crush rock, but the Pokémon can attack only the prey that come within reach of its tentacles.
pokecraft.species.omastar.name: Omastar
pokecraft.species.onix.desc: This chain of immense stones resembles a giant serpent. Tremors shake the earth above as it burrows deep beneath the ground, feeding on boulders as it goes.
pokecraft.species.onix.name: Onix
pokecraft.species.oranguru.desc: It knows the forest inside and out. If it comes across a wounded Pokémon, Oranguru will gather medicinal herbs to treat it.
pokecraft.species.oranguru.name: Oranguru
pokecraft.species.orbeetle.desc: It emits psychic energy to observe and study what’s around it—and what’s around it can include things over six miles away.
pokecraft.species.orbeetle.name: Orbeetle
pokecraft.species.oricorio.desc: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
pokecraft.species.oricorio.name: Oricorio
pokecraft.species.oshawott.desc: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name ”scalchop”.
pokecraft.species.oshawott.name: Oshawott
pokecraft.species.overqwil.desc: Its lancelike spikes and savage temperament have earned it the nickname ”sea fiend.” It slurps up poison to nourish itself.
pokecraft.species.overqwil.name: Overqwil
pokecraft.species.pachirisu.desc: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
pokecraft.species.pachirisu.name: Pachirisu
pokecraft.species.palkia.desc: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
pokecraft.species.palkia.name: Palkia
pokecraft.species.palossand.desc: This Pokémon lives on beaches, but it hates water. Palossand can’t maintain its castle-like shape if it gets drenched by a heavy rain.
pokecraft.species.palossand.name: Palossand
pokecraft.species.palpitoad.desc: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
pokecraft.species.palpitoad.name: Palpitoad
pokecraft.species.pancham.desc: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
pokecraft.species.pancham.name: Pancham
pokecraft.species.pangoro.desc: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
pokecraft.species.pangoro.name: Pangoro
pokecraft.species.panpour.desc: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
pokecraft.species.panpour.name: Panpour
pokecraft.species.pansage.desc: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
pokecraft.species.pansage.name: Pansage
pokecraft.species.pansear.desc: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.pansear.name: Pansear
pokecraft.species.paras.desc: Sometimes seen at the foot of trees in humid forests. The mushrooms on its back—called tochukaso—are not present on infant specimens and instead emerge as Paras matures.
pokecraft.species.paras.name: Paras
pokecraft.species.parasect.desc: Mushroom-lacking specimens of this Pokémon lie unmoving in the forest, lending credence to the hypothesis that the large mushroom is in control of Parasect's actions.
pokecraft.species.parasect.name: Parasect
pokecraft.species.passimian.desc: Passimian live in groups of about 20, with each member performing an assigned role. Through cooperation, the group survives.
pokecraft.species.passimian.name: Passimian
pokecraft.species.patrat.desc: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
pokecraft.species.patrat.name: Patrat
pokecraft.species.pawniard.desc: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
pokecraft.species.pawniard.name: Pawniard
pokecraft.species.pelipper.desc: Skimming the water’s surface, it dips its large bill in the sea, scoops up food and water, and carries it.
pokecraft.species.pelipper.name: Pelipper
pokecraft.species.perrserker.desc: After many battles, it evolved dangerous claws that come together to form daggers when extended.
pokecraft.species.perrserker.name: Perrserker
pokecraft.species.persian.desc: Its elegant and refined behavior clashes with that of the barbaric Perrserker. The relationship between the two is one of mutual disdain.
pokecraft.species.persian.name: Persian
pokecraft.species.petilil.desc: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
pokecraft.species.petilil.name: Petilil
pokecraft.species.phanpy.desc: Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.
pokecraft.species.phanpy.name: Phanpy
pokecraft.species.phantump.desc: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
pokecraft.species.phantump.name: Phantump
pokecraft.species.pheromosa.desc: Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.
pokecraft.species.pheromosa.name: Pheromosa
pokecraft.species.phione.desc: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
pokecraft.species.phione.name: Phione
pokecraft.species.pichu.desc: Pichu stores electricity in the sacs on its cheeks but discharges it inadvertently when agitated or excited. Being yet immature, the Pokémon's handling of electricity is rather inept.
pokecraft.species.pichu.name: Pichu
pokecraft.species.pidgeot.desc: This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
pokecraft.species.pidgeot.name: Pidgeot
pokecraft.species.pidgeotto.desc: This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
pokecraft.species.pidgeotto.name: Pidgeotto
pokecraft.species.pidgey.desc: Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
pokecraft.species.pidgey.name: Pidgey
pokecraft.species.pidove.desc: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
pokecraft.species.pidove.name: Pidove
pokecraft.species.pignite.desc: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
pokecraft.species.pignite.name: Pignite
pokecraft.species.pikachu.desc: Possesses cheek sacs in which it stores electricity. This clever forest-dweller roasts tough berries with an electric shock before consuming them.
pokecraft.species.pikachu.name: Pikachu
pokecraft.species.pikipek.desc: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
pokecraft.species.pikipek.name: Pikipek
pokecraft.species.piloswine.desc: The long fur of this Pokémon covers its eyes, ears, and even limbs, allowing Piloswine to resist harshly frigid conditions. The Pokémon's white tusks can be used to defeat its enemies.
pokecraft.species.piloswine.name: Piloswine
pokecraft.species.pincurchin.desc: It stores electricity in each spine. Even if one gets broken off, it still continues to emit electricity for at least three hours.
pokecraft.species.pincurchin.name: Pincurchin
pokecraft.species.pineco.desc: It sticks tree bark to itself with its saliva, making itself thicker and larger. Elderly Pineco are ridiculously huge.
pokecraft.species.pineco.name: Pineco
pokecraft.species.pinsir.desc: This Pokémon clamps its pincers down on its prey and then either splits the prey in half or flings it away.
pokecraft.species.pinsir.name: Pinsir
pokecraft.species.piplup.desc: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.
pokecraft.species.piplup.name: Piplup
pokecraft.species.plusle.desc: When Plusle is cheering on its partner, it flashes with electric sparks from all over its body. If its partner loses, this Pokémon cries loudly.
pokecraft.species.plusle.name: Plusle
pokecraft.species.poipole.desc: An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.
pokecraft.species.poipole.name: Poipole
pokecraft.species.politoed.desc: The cry of a male is louder than that of a female. Male Politoed with deep, menacing voices find more popularity with the opposite gender.
pokecraft.species.politoed.name: Politoed
pokecraft.species.poliwag.desc: In rivers with fast-flowing water, this Pokémon will cling to a rock by using its thick lips, which act like a suction cup.
pokecraft.species.poliwag.name: Poliwag
pokecraft.species.poliwhirl.desc: This Pokémon’s sweat is a slimy mucus. When captured, Poliwhirl can slither from its enemies’ grasp and escape.
pokecraft.species.poliwhirl.name: Poliwhirl
pokecraft.species.poliwrath.desc: Poliwrath is skilled at both swimming and martial arts. It uses its well-trained arms to dish out powerful punches.
pokecraft.species.poliwrath.name: Poliwrath
pokecraft.species.polteageist.desc: Leaving leftover black tea unattended is asking for this Pokémon to come along and pour itself into it, turning the tea into a new Polteageist.
pokecraft.species.polteageist.name: Polteageist
pokecraft.species.ponyta.desc: These Pokémon live in herds out in the grassland. Newborn foals lack their fiery manes, which will develop about an hour after birth.
pokecraft.species.ponyta.name: Ponyta
pokecraft.species.poochyena.desc: Poochyena is an omnivore—it will eat anything. A distinguishing feature is how large its fangs are compared to its body. This Pokémon tries to intimidate its foes by making the hair on its tail bristle out.
pokecraft.species.poochyena.name: Poochyena
pokecraft.species.popplio.desc: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
pokecraft.species.popplio.name: Popplio
pokecraft.species.porygon.desc: It has no discernible heartbeat and does not seem to draw breath, and yet it appears to function without issue. I cannot even begin to explain this utterly bizarre anomaly.
pokecraft.species.porygon.name: Porygon
pokecraft.species.porygon2.desc: A bizarre item caused this Pokémon to evolve. While it now exhibits many new gestures and expressions, its biology remains inscrutable.
pokecraft.species.porygon2.name: Porygon2
pokecraft.species.porygonz.desc: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
pokecraft.species.porygonz.name: Porygon-Z
pokecraft.species.primarina.desc: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
pokecraft.species.primarina.name: Primarina
pokecraft.species.primeape.desc: It stops being angry only when nobody else is around. To view this moment is very difficult.
pokecraft.species.primeape.name: Primeape
pokecraft.species.prinplup.desc: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
pokecraft.species.prinplup.name: Prinplup
pokecraft.species.probopass.desc: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
pokecraft.species.probopass.name: Probopass
pokecraft.species.psyduck.desc: Suffers perpetual headaches. If the agony grows too great, Psyduck's latent power erupts, contrary to Psyduck's intent. Ergo, I am exploring ways to ease the pain.
pokecraft.species.psyduck.name: Psyduck
pokecraft.species.pumpkaboo.desc: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
pokecraft.species.pumpkaboo.name: Pumpkaboo
pokecraft.species.pupitar.desc: It will not stay still, even while it’s a pupa. It already has arms and legs under its solid shell.
pokecraft.species.pupitar.name: Pupitar
pokecraft.species.purrloin.desc: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
pokecraft.species.purrloin.name: Purrloin
pokecraft.species.purugly.desc: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
pokecraft.species.purugly.name: Purugly
pokecraft.species.pyroar.desc: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.
pokecraft.species.pyroar.name: Pyroar
pokecraft.species.pyukumuku.desc: It lives in warm, shallow waters. If it encounters a foe, it will spit out its internal organs as a means to punch them.
pokecraft.species.pyukumuku.name: Pyukumuku
pokecraft.species.quagsire.desc: Its body is always slimy. It often bangs its head on the river bottom as it swims but seems not to care.
pokecraft.species.quagsire.name: Quagsire
pokecraft.species.quaquaval.name: Quaquaval
pokecraft.species.quaxly.name: Quaxly
pokecraft.species.quaxwell.name: Quaxwell
pokecraft.species.quilava.desc: This creature's fur is most mysterious—it is wholly impervious to the burning touch of flame. Should Quilava turn its back to you, take heed! Such a posture indicates a forthcoming attack.
pokecraft.species.quilava.name: Quilava
pokecraft.species.quilladin.desc: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.
pokecraft.species.quilladin.name: Quilladin
pokecraft.species.qwilfish.desc: Fishers detest this troublesome Pokémon because it sprays poison from its spines, getting it everywhere. A different form of Qwilfish lives in other regions.
pokecraft.species.qwilfish.name: Qwilfish
pokecraft.species.raboot.desc: It kicks berries right off the branches of trees and then juggles them with its feet, practicing its footwork.
pokecraft.species.raboot.name: Raboot
pokecraft.species.raichu.desc: It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts— a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.
pokecraft.species.raichu.name: Raichu
pokecraft.species.raikou.desc: Raikou embodies the speed of lightning. The roars of this Pokémon send shock waves shuddering through the air and shake the ground as if lightning bolts had come crashing down.
pokecraft.species.raikou.name: Raikou
pokecraft.species.ralts.desc: Tends to prefer people with a chipper disposition to those who are gloomy, but it has shown no discrimination with regard to age or gender. Needs more research.
pokecraft.species.ralts.name: Ralts
pokecraft.species.rampardos.desc: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
pokecraft.species.rampardos.name: Rampardos
pokecraft.species.rapidash.desc: Fiery mane aglow, Rapidash darts like an arrow across the land. This prodigiously swift creature can traverse the vast region of Hisui in a day and a half.
pokecraft.species.rapidash.name: Rapidash
pokecraft.species.raticate.desc: Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
pokecraft.species.raticate.name: Raticate
pokecraft.species.rattata.desc: Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
pokecraft.species.rattata.name: Rattata
pokecraft.species.rayquaza.desc: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
pokecraft.species.rayquaza.name: Rayquaza
pokecraft.species.regice.desc: This Pokémon’s body is made of solid ice. It’s said that Regice was born beneath thick ice in the ice age.
pokecraft.species.regice.name: Regice
pokecraft.species.regidrago.desc: Its body is composed of crystallized dragon energy. Regidrago is said to have the powers of every dragon Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.regidrago.name: Regidrago
pokecraft.species.regieleki.desc: Its entire body is made up of a single organ that generates electrical energy. Regieleki is capable of creating all Galar’s electricity.
pokecraft.species.regieleki.name: Regieleki
pokecraft.species.regigigas.desc: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
pokecraft.species.regigigas.name: Regigigas
pokecraft.species.regirock.desc: Cutting-edge technology was used to study the internals of this Pokémon’s rock body, but nothing was found—not even a brain or a heart.
pokecraft.species.regirock.name: Regirock
pokecraft.species.registeel.desc: It’s rumored that this Pokémon was born deep underground in the planet’s mantle and that it emerged onto the surface 10,000 years ago.
pokecraft.species.registeel.name: Registeel
pokecraft.species.relicanth.desc: This Pokémon was discovered during deep-sea exploration. Its appearance hasn’t changed in 100,000,000 years, so it’s called a living fossil.
pokecraft.species.relicanth.name: Relicanth
pokecraft.species.remoraid.desc: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
pokecraft.species.remoraid.name: Remoraid
pokecraft.species.reshiram.desc: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
pokecraft.species.reshiram.name: Reshiram
pokecraft.species.reuniclus.desc: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
pokecraft.species.reuniclus.name: Reuniclus
pokecraft.species.rhydon.desc: Rapidly rotates its horn to bore through bedrock. It swaggers around volcanic regions, protected from the lava's heat by its tough, armorlike hide.
pokecraft.species.rhydon.name: Rhydon
pokecraft.species.rhyhorn.desc: Ludicrously strong—when it butts heads with a mountain, it is the mountain that shatters. But its short legs struggle with turns, and it is incapable of stopping unless it collides with something.
pokecraft.species.rhyhorn.name: Rhyhorn
pokecraft.species.rhyperior.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
pokecraft.species.rhyperior.name: Rhyperior
pokecraft.species.ribombee.desc: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
pokecraft.species.ribombee.name: Ribombee
pokecraft.species.rillaboom.desc: The one with the best drumming techniques becomes the boss of the troop. It has a gentle disposition and values harmony among its group.
pokecraft.species.rillaboom.name: Rillaboom
pokecraft.species.riolu.desc: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
pokecraft.species.riolu.name: Riolu
pokecraft.species.rockruff.desc: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
pokecraft.species.rockruff.name: Rockruff
pokecraft.species.roggenrola.desc: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
pokecraft.species.roggenrola.name: Roggenrola
pokecraft.species.rolycoly.desc: It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
pokecraft.species.rolycoly.name: Rolycoly
pokecraft.species.rookidee.desc: Jumping nimbly about, this small-bodied Pokémon takes advantage of even the slightest opportunity to disorient larger opponents.
pokecraft.species.rookidee.name: Rookidee
pokecraft.species.roselia.desc: Though beautiful, it has highly poisonous thorns. There is an old tradition in my homeland wherein one would send these thorns to an opponent to challenge them to a duel.
pokecraft.species.roselia.name: Roselia
pokecraft.species.roserade.desc: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
pokecraft.species.roserade.name: Roserade
pokecraft.species.rotom.desc: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
pokecraft.species.rotom.name: Rotom
pokecraft.species.rowlet.desc: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
pokecraft.species.rowlet.name: Rowlet
pokecraft.species.rufflet.desc: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.
pokecraft.species.rufflet.name: Rufflet
pokecraft.species.runerigus.desc: Never touch its shadowlike body, or you’ll be shown the horrific memories behind the picture carved into it.
pokecraft.species.runerigus.name: Runerigus
pokecraft.species.sableye.desc: It feeds on gemstone crystals. In darkness, its eyes sparkle with the glitter of jewels.
pokecraft.species.sableye.name: Sableye
pokecraft.species.salamence.desc: While basking in the joy of flight generally keeps this Pokémon in high spirits, Salamence turns into an uncontrollable menace if something angers it.
pokecraft.species.salamence.name: Salamence
pokecraft.species.salandit.desc: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
pokecraft.species.salandit.name: Salandit
pokecraft.species.salazzle.desc: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
pokecraft.species.salazzle.name: Salazzle
pokecraft.species.samurott.desc: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
pokecraft.species.samurott.name: Samurott
pokecraft.species.sandaconda.desc: Its unique style of coiling allows it to blast sand out of its sand sac more efficiently.
pokecraft.species.sandaconda.name: Sandaconda
pokecraft.species.sandile.desc: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
pokecraft.species.sandile.name: Sandile
pokecraft.species.sandshrew.desc: It burrows into the ground to create its nest. If hard stones impede its tunneling, it uses its sharp claws to shatter them and then carries on digging.
pokecraft.species.sandshrew.name: Sandshrew
pokecraft.species.sandslash.desc: It climbs trees by hooking on with its sharp claws. Sandslash shares the berries it gathers, dropping them down to Sandshrew waiting below the tree.
pokecraft.species.sandslash.name: Sandslash
pokecraft.species.sandygast.desc: Sandygast mainly inhabits beaches. It takes control of anyone who puts their hand into its mouth, forcing them to make its body bigger.
pokecraft.species.sandygast.name: Sandygast
pokecraft.species.sawk.desc: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
pokecraft.species.sawk.name: Sawk
pokecraft.species.sawsbuck.desc: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
pokecraft.species.sawsbuck.name: Sawsbuck
pokecraft.species.scatterbug.desc: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
pokecraft.species.scatterbug.name: Scatterbug
pokecraft.species.sceptile.desc: Sceptile has seeds growing on its back. They are said to be bursting with nutrients that revitalize trees. This Pokémon raises the trees in a forest with loving care.
pokecraft.species.sceptile.name: Sceptile
pokecraft.species.scizor.desc: Evolved by way of a curious item. The shell covering its body has been shown to be stronger than forged steel.
pokecraft.species.scizor.name: Scizor
pokecraft.species.scolipede.desc: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
pokecraft.species.scolipede.name: Scolipede
pokecraft.species.scorbunny.desc: It has special pads on the backs of its feet, and one on its nose. Once it’s raring to fight, these pads radiate tremendous heat.
pokecraft.species.scorbunny.name: Scorbunny
pokecraft.species.scrafty.desc: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
pokecraft.species.scrafty.name: Scrafty
pokecraft.species.scraggy.desc: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
pokecraft.species.scraggy.name: Scraggy
pokecraft.species.scyther.desc: The large, wickedly sharp scythes on its forearms are truly fearsome weapons. Prey's attempts to flee are unfailingly thwarted by this Pokémon's nimble motions.
pokecraft.species.scyther.name: Scyther
pokecraft.species.seadra.desc: Seadra’s mouth is slender, but its suction power is strong. In an instant, Seadra can suck in food that’s larger than the opening of its mouth.
pokecraft.species.seadra.name: Seadra
pokecraft.species.seaking.desc: Using its horn, it bores holes in riverbed boulders, making nests to prevent its eggs from washing away.
pokecraft.species.seaking.name: Seaking
pokecraft.species.sealeo.desc: Its white whiskers are very sensitive. Sealeo will balance Spheal on the tip of its nose, checking its scent and its feel to be sure the Spheal is healthy.
pokecraft.species.sealeo.name: Sealeo
pokecraft.species.seedot.desc: It attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. Strong winds can sometimes make it fall.
pokecraft.species.seedot.name: Seedot
pokecraft.species.seel.desc: Loves freezing-cold conditions. Relishes swimming in a frigid climate of around 14 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.seel.name: Seel
pokecraft.species.seismitoad.desc: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
pokecraft.species.seismitoad.name: Seismitoad
pokecraft.species.sentret.desc: When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
pokecraft.species.sentret.name: Sentret
pokecraft.species.serperior.desc: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
pokecraft.species.serperior.name: Serperior
pokecraft.species.servine.desc: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
pokecraft.species.servine.name: Servine
pokecraft.species.seviper.desc: Seviper’s swordlike tail serves two purposes—it slashes foes and douses them with secreted poison. This Pokémon will not give up its long-running blood feud with Zangoose.
pokecraft.species.seviper.name: Seviper
pokecraft.species.sewaddle.desc: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
pokecraft.species.sewaddle.name: Sewaddle
pokecraft.species.sharpedo.desc: This Pokémon is known as the Bully of the Sea. Any ship entering the waters Sharpedo calls home will be attacked—no exceptions.
pokecraft.species.sharpedo.name: Sharpedo
pokecraft.species.shaymin.desc: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
pokecraft.species.shaymin.name: Shaymin
pokecraft.species.shedinja.desc: A strange Pokémon—it flies without moving its wings, has a hollow shell for a body, and does not breathe.
pokecraft.species.shedinja.name: Shedinja
pokecraft.species.shelgon.desc: Shelgon ignores its hunger entirely, never eating any food. Apparently, Shelgon will evolve once all its energy stores are used up.
pokecraft.species.shelgon.name: Shelgon
pokecraft.species.shellder.desc: Its hard shell repels any kind of attack. It is vulnerable only when its shell is open.
pokecraft.species.shellder.name: Shellder
pokecraft.species.shellos.desc: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
pokecraft.species.shellos.name: Shellos
pokecraft.species.shelmet.desc: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
pokecraft.species.shelmet.name: Shelmet
pokecraft.species.shieldon.desc: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
pokecraft.species.shieldon.name: Shieldon
pokecraft.species.shiftry.desc: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.
pokecraft.species.shiftry.name: Shiftry
pokecraft.species.shiinotic.desc: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
pokecraft.species.shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
pokecraft.species.shinx.desc: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.shinx.name: Shinx
pokecraft.species.shroomish.desc: If Shroomish senses danger, it shakes its body and scatters spores from the top of its head. This Pokémon’s spores are so toxic, they make trees and weeds wilt.
pokecraft.species.shroomish.name: Shroomish
pokecraft.species.shuckle.desc: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.
pokecraft.species.shuckle.name: Shuckle
pokecraft.species.shuppet.desc: There’s a proverb that says, “Shun the house where Shuppet gather in the growing dusk.”
pokecraft.species.shuppet.name: Shuppet
pokecraft.species.sigilyph.desc: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
pokecraft.species.sigilyph.name: Sigilyph
pokecraft.species.silcoon.desc: Wraps itself in thin strings of silk while it stores energy for evolution. It can't extend its limbs and its movement is slow, but its eyes keep a sharp lookout—Silcoon is always on guard.
pokecraft.species.silcoon.name: Silcoon
pokecraft.species.silicobra.desc: It spews sand from its nostrils. While the enemy is blinded, it burrows into the ground to hide.
pokecraft.species.silicobra.name: Silicobra
pokecraft.species.silvally.desc: The final factor needed to release this Pokémon’s true power was a strong bond with a Trainer it trusts.
pokecraft.species.silvally.name: Silvally
pokecraft.species.simipour.desc: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
pokecraft.species.simipour.name: Simipour
pokecraft.species.simisage.desc: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
pokecraft.species.simisage.name: Simisage
pokecraft.species.simisear.desc: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
pokecraft.species.simisear.name: Simisear
pokecraft.species.sinistea.desc: The teacup in which this Pokémon makes its home is a famous piece of antique tableware. Many forgeries are in circulation.
pokecraft.species.sinistea.name: Sinistea
pokecraft.species.sirfetchd.desc: After deflecting attacks with its hard leaf shield, it strikes back with its sharp leek stalk. The leek stalk is both weapon and food.
pokecraft.species.sirfetchd.name: Sirfetch’d
pokecraft.species.sizzlipede.desc: It wraps prey up with its heated body, cooking them in its coils. Once they’re well-done, it will voraciously nibble them down to the last morsel.
pokecraft.species.sizzlipede.name: Sizzlipede
pokecraft.species.skarmory.desc: People fashion swords from Skarmory’s shed feathers, so this Pokémon is a popular element in heraldic designs.
pokecraft.species.skarmory.name: Skarmory
pokecraft.species.skeledirge.name: Skeledirge
pokecraft.species.skiddo.desc: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
pokecraft.species.skiddo.name: Skiddo
pokecraft.species.skiploom.desc: Skiploom’s flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
pokecraft.species.skiploom.name: Skiploom
pokecraft.species.skitty.desc: Skitty is known to chase around playfully after its own tail. In the wild, this Pokémon lives in holes in the trees of forests. It is very popular as a pet because of its adorable looks.
pokecraft.species.skitty.name: Skitty
pokecraft.species.skorupi.desc: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
pokecraft.species.skorupi.name: Skorupi
pokecraft.species.skrelp.desc: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
pokecraft.species.skrelp.name: Skrelp
pokecraft.species.skuntank.desc: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
pokecraft.species.skuntank.name: Skuntank
pokecraft.species.skwovet.desc: It eats berries nonstop—a habit that has made it more resilient than it looks. It’ll show up on farms, searching for yet more berries.
pokecraft.species.skwovet.name: Skwovet
pokecraft.species.slaking.desc: Wherever Slaking live, rings of over a yard in diameter appear in grassy fields. They are made by the Pokémon as it eats all the grass within reach while lying prone on the ground.
pokecraft.species.slaking.name: Slaking
pokecraft.species.slakoth.desc: Slakoth’s heart beats just once a minute. Whatever happens, it is content to loaf around motionless. It is rare to see this Pokémon in motion.
pokecraft.species.slakoth.name: Slakoth
pokecraft.species.sliggoo.desc: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
pokecraft.species.sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
pokecraft.species.slowbro.desc: Being bitten by a Shellder shocked this Pokémon into standing on two legs. If the Shellder lets go, it seems Slowbro will turn back into a Slowpoke.
pokecraft.species.slowbro.name: Slowbro
pokecraft.species.slowking.desc: Slowking can solve any problem presented to it, but no one can understand a thing Slowking says.
pokecraft.species.slowking.name: Slowking
pokecraft.species.slowpoke.desc: When this Pokémon’s tail is soaked in water, sweetness seeps from it. Slowpoke uses this trait to lure in and fish up other Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.slowpoke.name: Slowpoke
pokecraft.species.slugma.desc: Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon’s body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
pokecraft.species.slugma.name: Slugma
pokecraft.species.slurpuff.desc: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
pokecraft.species.slurpuff.name: Slurpuff
pokecraft.species.smeargle.desc: It draws symbols with the fluid that oozes from the tip of its tail. Depending on the symbol, Smeargle fanatics will pay big money for them.
pokecraft.species.smeargle.name: Smeargle
pokecraft.species.smoochum.desc: This is a very curious Pokémon. Smoochum decides what it likes and dislikes by touching things with its lips.
pokecraft.species.smoochum.name: Smoochum
pokecraft.species.sneasel.desc: Its sturdy, curved claws are ideal for traversing precipitous cliffs. From the tips of these claws drips a venom that infiltrates the nerves of any prey caught in Sneasel's grasp.
pokecraft.species.sneasel.name: Sneasel
pokecraft.species.sneasler.desc: Because of Sneasler's virulent poison and daunting physical prowess, no other species could hope to best it on the frozen highlands. Preferring solitude, this species does not form packs.
pokecraft.species.sneasler.name: Sneasler
pokecraft.species.snivy.desc: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
pokecraft.species.snivy.name: Snivy
pokecraft.species.snom.desc: It eats snow that piles up on the ground. The more snow it eats, the bigger and more impressive the spikes on its back grow.
pokecraft.species.snom.name: Snom
pokecraft.species.snorlax.desc: This glutton appears in villages without warning and devours the entirety of their rice granaries—such occurrences have long been counted among the gravest of disasters.
pokecraft.species.snorlax.name: Snorlax
pokecraft.species.snorunt.desc: Arrives alongside the first snow. It's thought that homes Snorunt visit will prosper for many generations. By tradition, one might offer a lump of ice made from pure water at one's front door.
pokecraft.species.snorunt.name: Snorunt
pokecraft.species.snover.desc: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
pokecraft.species.snover.name: Snover
pokecraft.species.snubbull.desc: In contrast to its appearance, it’s quite timid. When playing with other puppy Pokémon, it sometimes gets bullied.
pokecraft.species.snubbull.name: Snubbull
pokecraft.species.sobble.desc: When it gets wet, its skin changes color, and this Pokémon becomes invisible as if it were camouflaged.
pokecraft.species.sobble.name: Sobble
pokecraft.species.solgaleo.desc: Solgaleo was once known as the Beast That Devours the Sun. Energy in the form of light radiates boundlessly from it.
pokecraft.species.solgaleo.name: Solgaleo
pokecraft.species.solosis.desc: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
pokecraft.species.solosis.name: Solosis
pokecraft.species.solrock.desc: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.
pokecraft.species.solrock.name: Solrock
pokecraft.species.spearow.desc: Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
pokecraft.species.spearow.name: Spearow
pokecraft.species.spectrier.desc: As it dashes through the night, Spectrier absorbs the life-force of sleeping creatures. It craves silence and solitude.
pokecraft.species.spectrier.name: Spectrier
pokecraft.species.spewpa.desc: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
pokecraft.species.spewpa.name: Spewpa
pokecraft.species.spheal.desc: During the season when drift ice approaches the shore, Spheal prefers living on the ice—where fewer predators lurk—rather than the land. Its fur retains heat superbly and resists harsh cold.
pokecraft.species.spheal.name: Spheal
pokecraft.species.spinarak.desc: Although the poison from its fangs isn’t that strong, it’s potent enough to weaken prey that gets caught in its web.
pokecraft.species.spinarak.name: Spinarak
pokecraft.species.spinda.desc: Each Spinda’s spot pattern is different. With its stumbling movements, it evades opponents’ attacks brilliantly!
pokecraft.species.spinda.name: Spinda
pokecraft.species.spiritomb.desc: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
pokecraft.species.spiritomb.name: Spiritomb
pokecraft.species.spoink.desc: Spoink keeps a pearl on top of its head. The pearl functions to amplify this Pokémon’s psychokinetic powers. It is therefore on a constant search for a bigger pearl.
pokecraft.species.spoink.name: Spoink
pokecraft.species.sprigatito.name: Sprigatito
pokecraft.species.spritzee.desc: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
pokecraft.species.spritzee.name: Spritzee
pokecraft.species.squirtle.desc: When it feels threatened, it draws its limbs inside its shell and sprays water from its mouth.
pokecraft.species.squirtle.name: Squirtle
pokecraft.species.stakataka.desc: When stone walls started moving and attacking, the brute’s true identity was this mysterious life-form, which brings to mind an Ultra Beast.
pokecraft.species.stakataka.name: Stakataka
pokecraft.species.stantler.desc: Its strangely shaped antlers have the power to bewitch those who see them. Medicine made by grinding up the black orbs from fallen antlers is an effective treatment for insomnia.
pokecraft.species.stantler.name: Stantler
pokecraft.species.staraptor.desc: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
pokecraft.species.staraptor.name: Staraptor
pokecraft.species.staravia.desc: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
pokecraft.species.staravia.name: Staravia
pokecraft.species.starly.desc: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
pokecraft.species.starly.name: Starly
pokecraft.species.starmie.desc: Starmie swims by spinning its body at high speed. As this Pokémon cruises through the ocean, it absorbs tiny plankton.
pokecraft.species.starmie.name: Starmie
pokecraft.species.staryu.desc: Fish Pokémon nibble at it, but Staryu isn’t bothered. Its body regenerates quickly, even if part of it is completely torn off.
pokecraft.species.staryu.name: Staryu
pokecraft.species.steelix.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a strange item. Its body is coated with steel powder and notably hard—not even diamond can leave so much as a scratch.
pokecraft.species.steelix.name: Steelix
pokecraft.species.steenee.desc: Any Corvisquire that pecks at this Pokémon will be greeted with a smack from its sepals followed by a sharp kick.
pokecraft.species.steenee.name: Steenee
pokecraft.species.stonjourner.desc: Once a year, on a specific date and at a specific time, they gather out of nowhere and form up in a circle.
pokecraft.species.stonjourner.name: Stonjourner
pokecraft.species.stoutland.desc: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
pokecraft.species.stoutland.name: Stoutland
pokecraft.species.stufful.desc: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
pokecraft.species.stufful.name: Stufful
pokecraft.species.stunfisk.desc: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
pokecraft.species.stunfisk.name: Stunfisk
pokecraft.species.stunky.desc: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
pokecraft.species.stunky.name: Stunky
pokecraft.species.sudowoodo.desc: Though it pretends to be a tree, it fails to fool even children. To the touch, its body feels more like rock than tree bark. Sudowoodo's extreme aversion to water merits special note.
pokecraft.species.sudowoodo.name: Sudowoodo
pokecraft.species.suicune.desc: Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.
pokecraft.species.suicune.name: Suicune
pokecraft.species.sunflora.desc: Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
pokecraft.species.sunflora.name: Sunflora
pokecraft.species.sunkern.desc: Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
pokecraft.species.sunkern.name: Sunkern
pokecraft.species.surskit.desc: It lives in ponds and marshes that feature lots of plant life. It often fights with Dewpider, whose habitat and diet are similar.
pokecraft.species.surskit.name: Surskit
pokecraft.species.swablu.desc: Since Swablu looks like a cumulus cloud, foes can have a hard time finding it. Apparently its wings turned white over many generations.
