pokecraft.species.swablu.name: Swablu
pokecraft.species.swadloon.desc: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
pokecraft.species.swadloon.name: Swadloon
pokecraft.species.swalot.desc: Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon’s mouth.
pokecraft.species.swalot.name: Swalot
pokecraft.species.swampert.desc: Swampert predicts storms by sensing subtle differences in the sounds of waves and tidal winds with its fins. If a storm is approaching, it piles up boulders to protect itself.
pokecraft.species.swampert.name: Swampert
pokecraft.species.swanna.desc: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
pokecraft.species.swanna.name: Swanna
pokecraft.species.swellow.desc: Swellow is very conscientious about the upkeep of its glossy wings. Once two Swellow are gathered, they diligently take care of cleaning each other’s wings.
pokecraft.species.swellow.name: Swellow
pokecraft.species.swinub.desc: Swinub excels at sniffing out mushrooms buried beneath grass or snow. Since ancient times, the people of Hisui have often relied upon this skill.
pokecraft.species.swinub.name: Swinub
pokecraft.species.swirlix.desc: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
pokecraft.species.swirlix.name: Swirlix
pokecraft.species.swoobat.desc: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
pokecraft.species.swoobat.name: Swoobat
pokecraft.species.sylveon.desc: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
pokecraft.species.sylveon.name: Sylveon
pokecraft.species.taillow.desc: Taillow is young—it has only just left its nest. As a result, it sometimes becomes lonesome and cries at night. This Pokémon feeds on Wurmple that live in forests.
pokecraft.species.taillow.name: Taillow
pokecraft.species.talonflame.desc: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
pokecraft.species.talonflame.name: Talonflame
pokecraft.species.tangela.desc: It is cloaked entirely in blue vines, preventing any glimpse of its true identity. The vines impart a refreshing sensation when chewed—they're useful as a spice.
pokecraft.species.tangela.name: Tangela
pokecraft.species.tangrowth.desc: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
pokecraft.species.tangrowth.name: Tangrowth
pokecraft.species.tapubulu.desc: It makes ringing sounds with its tail to let others know where it is, avoiding unneeded conflicts. This guardian deity of Ula’ula controls plants.
pokecraft.species.tapubulu.name: Tapu Bulu
pokecraft.species.tapufini.desc: Although it’s called a guardian deity, terrible calamities sometimes befall those who recklessly approach Tapu Fini.
pokecraft.species.tapufini.name: Tapu Fini
pokecraft.species.tapukoko.desc: The lightning-wielding guardian deity of Melemele, Tapu Koko is brimming with curiosity and appears before people from time to time.
pokecraft.species.tapukoko.name: Tapu Koko
pokecraft.species.tapulele.desc: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.
pokecraft.species.tapulele.name: Tapu Lele
pokecraft.species.tauros.desc: The Tauros of the Galar region are volatile in nature, and they won’t allow people to ride on their backs.
pokecraft.species.tauros.name: Tauros
pokecraft.species.teddiursa.desc: It licks its paws because of the sweet honey that has soaked into them. It is cunning, stealing into the nests of Combee and taking for itself the honey that the Combee have amassed.
pokecraft.species.teddiursa.name: Teddiursa
pokecraft.species.tentacool.desc: They fire beams from the glassy, magenta orbs that resemble eyes atop their heads, and they drift in shallow seas. During low tide, they can sometimes be found on beaches, desiccated.
pokecraft.species.tentacool.name: Tentacool
pokecraft.species.tentacruel.desc: It has 80 tentacles, each with a venomous tip. These tentacles are also extendible, lengthening when Tentacruel attempts to catch prey. Use caution.
pokecraft.species.tentacruel.name: Tentacruel
pokecraft.species.tepig.desc: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
pokecraft.species.tepig.name: Tepig
pokecraft.species.terrakion.desc: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.terrakion.name: Terrakion
pokecraft.species.thievul.desc: With a lithe body and sharp claws, it goes around stealing food and eggs. Boltund is its natural enemy.
pokecraft.species.thievul.name: Thievul
pokecraft.species.throh.desc: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
pokecraft.species.throh.name: Throh
pokecraft.species.thundurus.desc: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.
pokecraft.species.thundurus.name: Thundurus
pokecraft.species.thwackey.desc: When it’s drumming out rapid beats in battle, it gets so caught up in the rhythm that it won’t even notice that it’s already knocked out its opponent.
pokecraft.species.thwackey.name: Thwackey
pokecraft.species.timburr.desc: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
pokecraft.species.timburr.name: Timburr
pokecraft.species.tirtouga.desc: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
pokecraft.species.tirtouga.name: Tirtouga
pokecraft.species.togedemaru.desc: When it’s in trouble, it curls up into a ball, makes its fur spikes stand on end, and then discharges electricity indiscriminately.
pokecraft.species.togedemaru.name: Togedemaru
pokecraft.species.togekiss.desc: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
pokecraft.species.togekiss.name: Togekiss
pokecraft.species.togepi.desc: This ovate creature is frequently mistaken for a moving egg when encountered out in the fields or in the mountains. Its guileless smile soothes the soul.
pokecraft.species.togepi.name: Togepi
pokecraft.species.togetic.desc: No records exist of Togetic being seen in the wilds. Rumors abound that it evolves under the loving care of a trusted human companion, upon whom the Pokémon then bestows great joy.
pokecraft.species.togetic.name: Togetic
pokecraft.species.torchic.desc: Torchic has a place inside its body where it keeps its flame. Give it a hug—it will be glowing with warmth. This Pokémon is covered all over by a fluffy coat of down.
pokecraft.species.torchic.name: Torchic
pokecraft.species.torkoal.desc: You find abandoned coal mines full of them. They dig tirelessly in search of coal.
pokecraft.species.torkoal.name: Torkoal
pokecraft.species.tornadus.desc: This storm-stirring Pokémon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its human_like form to be a false one.
pokecraft.species.tornadus.name: Tornadus
pokecraft.species.torracat.desc: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
pokecraft.species.torracat.name: Torracat
pokecraft.species.torterra.desc: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
pokecraft.species.torterra.name: Torterra
pokecraft.species.totodile.desc: Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile’s jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
pokecraft.species.totodile.name: Totodile
pokecraft.species.toucannon.desc: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
pokecraft.species.toucannon.name: Toucannon
pokecraft.species.toxapex.desc: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
pokecraft.species.toxapex.name: Toxapex
pokecraft.species.toxel.desc: It manipulates the chemical makeup of its poison to produce electricity. The voltage is weak, but it can cause a tingling paralysis.
pokecraft.species.toxel.name: Toxel
pokecraft.species.toxicroak.desc: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
pokecraft.species.toxicroak.name: Toxicroak
pokecraft.species.toxtricity.desc: This short-tempered and aggressive Pokémon chugs stagnant water to absorb any toxins it might contain.
pokecraft.species.toxtricity.name: Toxtricity
pokecraft.species.tranquill.desc: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
pokecraft.species.tranquill.name: Tranquill
pokecraft.species.trapinch.desc: It makes an inescapable conical pit and lies in wait at the bottom for prey to come tumbling down.
pokecraft.species.trapinch.name: Trapinch
pokecraft.species.treecko.desc: Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.
pokecraft.species.treecko.name: Treecko
pokecraft.species.trevenant.desc: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
pokecraft.species.trevenant.name: Trevenant
pokecraft.species.tropius.desc: Bunches of delicious fruit grow around its neck. In warm areas, many ranches raise Tropius.
pokecraft.species.tropius.name: Tropius
pokecraft.species.trubbish.desc: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
pokecraft.species.trubbish.name: Trubbish
pokecraft.species.trumbeak.desc: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
pokecraft.species.trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
pokecraft.species.tsareena.desc: A kick from the hardened tips of this Pokémon’s legs leaves a wound in the opponent’s body and soul that will never heal.
pokecraft.species.tsareena.name: Tsareena
pokecraft.species.turtonator.desc: Eating sulfur in its volcanic habitat is what causes explosive compounds to develop in its shell. Its droppings are also dangerously explosive.
pokecraft.species.turtonator.name: Turtonator
pokecraft.species.turtwig.desc: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
pokecraft.species.turtwig.name: Turtwig
pokecraft.species.tympole.desc: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
pokecraft.species.tympole.name: Tympole
pokecraft.species.tynamo.desc: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
pokecraft.species.tynamo.name: Tynamo
pokecraft.species.typenull.desc: It was modeled after a mighty Pokémon of myth. The mask placed upon it limits its power in order to keep it under control.
pokecraft.species.typenull.name: Type Null
pokecraft.species.typhlosion.desc: Said to purify lost, forsaken souls with its flames and guide them to the afterlife. I believe its form has been influenced by the energy of the sacred mountain towering at Hisui's center.
pokecraft.species.typhlosion.name: Typhlosion
pokecraft.species.tyranitar.desc: The quakes caused when it walks make even great mountains crumble and change the surrounding terrain.
pokecraft.species.tyranitar.name: Tyranitar
pokecraft.species.tyrantrum.desc: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
pokecraft.species.tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
pokecraft.species.tyrogue.desc: Even though it is small, it can’t be ignored because it will slug any handy target without warning.
pokecraft.species.tyrogue.name: Tyrogue
pokecraft.species.tyrunt.desc: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
pokecraft.species.tyrunt.name: Tyrunt
pokecraft.species.umbreon.desc: It is most active in the wee hours of the night, when moonlight bathes the land. Its large eyes can pierce the darkness and perceive prey with absolute clarity.
pokecraft.species.umbreon.name: Umbreon
pokecraft.species.unfezant.desc: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
pokecraft.species.unfezant.name: Unfezant
pokecraft.species.unown.desc: It is hard to believe these strangely shaped Pokémon are truly living creatures. I've pointed out that the species' many forms resemble writing from other lands; no one will take me seriously.
pokecraft.species.unown.name: Unown
pokecraft.species.ursaluna.desc: I believe it was Hisui's swampy terrain that gave Ursaluna its burly physique and newfound capacity to manipulate peat at will.
pokecraft.species.ursaluna.name: Ursaluna
pokecraft.species.ursaring.desc: When the cold season arrives in Hisui, this Pokémon will wander fields and mountains alike in search of its favorite berries. Ursaring's hunger during this time makes it a ferocious danger.
pokecraft.species.ursaring.name: Ursaring
pokecraft.species.urshifu.desc: Inhabiting the mountains of a distant region, this Pokémon races across sheer cliffs, training its legs and refining its moves.
pokecraft.species.urshifu.name: Urshifu
pokecraft.species.uxie.desc: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.
pokecraft.species.uxie.name: Uxie
pokecraft.species.vanillish.desc: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.vanillish.name: Vanillish
pokecraft.species.vanillite.desc: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
pokecraft.species.vanillite.name: Vanillite
pokecraft.species.vanilluxe.desc: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.vanilluxe.name: Vanilluxe
pokecraft.species.vaporeon.desc: Tests show that its cells closely resemble water molecules, which perhaps explains its ability to conceal its form while submerged. I believe the origins of mermaid folklore lie with this Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.vaporeon.name: Vaporeon
pokecraft.species.venipede.desc: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
pokecraft.species.venipede.name: Venipede
pokecraft.species.venomoth.desc: The powdery scales on its wings are hard to remove from skin. They also contain poison that leaks out on contact.
pokecraft.species.venomoth.name: Venomoth
pokecraft.species.venonat.desc: Its large eyes act as radar. In a bright place, you can see that they are clusters of many tiny eyes.
pokecraft.species.venonat.name: Venonat
pokecraft.species.venusaur.desc: A bewitching aroma wafts from its flower. The fragrance becalms those engaged in a battle.
pokecraft.species.venusaur.name: Venusaur
pokecraft.species.vespiquen.desc: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
pokecraft.species.vespiquen.name: Vespiquen
pokecraft.species.vibrava.desc: To help make its wings grow, it dissolves quantities of prey in its digestive juices and guzzles them down every day.
pokecraft.species.vibrava.name: Vibrava
pokecraft.species.victini.desc: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.
pokecraft.species.victini.name: Victini
pokecraft.species.victreebel.desc: Lures prey with the sweet aroma of honey. Swallowed whole, the prey is dissolved in a day, bones and all.
pokecraft.species.victreebel.name: Victreebel
pokecraft.species.vigoroth.desc: Vigoroth is simply incapable of remaining still. Even when it tries to sleep, the blood in its veins grows agitated, compelling this Pokémon to run wild throughout the jungle before it can settle down.
pokecraft.species.vigoroth.name: Vigoroth
pokecraft.species.vikavolt.desc: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
pokecraft.species.vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
pokecraft.species.vileplume.desc: The larger its petals, the more toxic pollen it contains. Its big head is heavy and hard to hold up.
pokecraft.species.vileplume.name: Vileplume
pokecraft.species.virizion.desc: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
pokecraft.species.virizion.name: Virizion
pokecraft.species.vivillon.desc: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
pokecraft.species.vivillon.name: Vivillon
pokecraft.species.volbeat.desc: Volbeat’s tail glows like a lightbulb. With other Volbeat, it uses its tail to draw geometric shapes in the night sky. This Pokémon loves the sweet aroma given off by Illumise.
pokecraft.species.volbeat.name: Volbeat
pokecraft.species.volcanion.desc: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
pokecraft.species.volcanion.name: Volcanion
pokecraft.species.volcarona.desc: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.
pokecraft.species.volcarona.name: Volcarona
pokecraft.species.voltorb.desc: An enigmatic Pokémon that happens to bear a resemblance to a Poké Ball. When excited, it discharges the electric current it has stored in its belly, then lets out a great, uproarious laugh.
pokecraft.species.voltorb.name: Voltorb
pokecraft.species.vullaby.desc: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
pokecraft.species.vullaby.name: Vullaby
pokecraft.species.vulpix.desc: In its belly burns a fire, which Vulpix spits out in the form of fireballs. When young, this Pokémon has but one white tail. As the Pokémon matures, this single tail splits into six.
pokecraft.species.vulpix.name: Vulpix
pokecraft.species.wailmer.desc: When it sucks in a large volume of seawater, it becomes like a big, bouncy ball. It eats a ton of food daily.
pokecraft.species.wailmer.name: Wailmer
pokecraft.species.wailord.desc: Its immense size is the reason for its popularity. Wailord watching is a favorite sightseeing activity in various parts of the world.
pokecraft.species.wailord.name: Wailord
pokecraft.species.walrein.desc: Its thick tusks are strong enough to shatter drift ice. They have been known to break, but they will grow back by the next year. The Hisui region is well known for these broken tusks.
pokecraft.species.walrein.name: Walrein
pokecraft.species.wartortle.desc: It cleverly controls its furry ears and tail to maintain its balance while swimming.
pokecraft.species.wartortle.name: Wartortle
pokecraft.species.watchog.desc: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
pokecraft.species.watchog.name: Watchog
pokecraft.species.weavile.desc: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
pokecraft.species.weavile.name: Weavile
pokecraft.species.weedle.desc: Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
pokecraft.species.weedle.name: Weedle
pokecraft.species.weepinbell.desc: When hungry, it swallows anything that moves. Its hapless prey is dissolved by strong acids.
pokecraft.species.weepinbell.name: Weepinbell
pokecraft.species.weezing.desc: It can’t suck in air quite as well as a Galarian Weezing, but the toxins it creates are more potent than those of its counterpart.
pokecraft.species.weezing.name: Weezing
pokecraft.species.whimsicott.desc: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
pokecraft.species.whimsicott.name: Whimsicott
pokecraft.species.whirlipede.desc: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
pokecraft.species.whirlipede.name: Whirlipede
pokecraft.species.whiscash.desc: Strikes its caudal fin against the swamp bed to shake the ground and startle its prey. It will then swallow the fleeing prey whole. People mistook this behavior as the cause of earthquakes.
pokecraft.species.whiscash.name: Whiscash
pokecraft.species.whismur.desc: When Whismur cries, the sound of its own voice startles it, making the Pokémon cry even louder. It cries until it’s exhausted, then it falls asleep.
pokecraft.species.whismur.name: Whismur
pokecraft.species.wigglytuff.desc: It’s proud of its fur, which is fine and delicate. In particular, the curl on its forehead has a texture that’s perfectly heavenly.
pokecraft.species.wigglytuff.name: Wigglytuff
pokecraft.species.wimpod.desc: Wimpod gather in swarms, constantly on the lookout for danger. They scatter the moment they detect an enemy’s presence.
pokecraft.species.wimpod.name: Wimpod
pokecraft.species.wingull.desc: It soars on updrafts without flapping its wings. It makes a nest on sheer cliffs at the sea’s edge.
pokecraft.species.wingull.name: Wingull
pokecraft.species.wishiwashi.desc: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
pokecraft.species.wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
pokecraft.species.wobbuffet.desc: To keep its pitch-black tail hidden, it lives quietly in the darkness. It is never first to attack.
pokecraft.species.wobbuffet.name: Wobbuffet
pokecraft.species.woobat.desc: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.woobat.name: Woobat
pokecraft.species.wooloo.desc: If its fleece grows too long, Wooloo won’t be able to move. Cloth made with the wool of this Pokémon is surprisingly strong.
pokecraft.species.wooloo.name: Wooloo
pokecraft.species.wooper.desc: When walking on land, it covers its body with a poisonous film that keeps its skin from dehydrating.
pokecraft.species.wooper.name: Wooper
pokecraft.species.wormadam.desc: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
pokecraft.species.wormadam.name: Wormadam
pokecraft.species.wurmple.desc: Likes sap and is abundant in the wild. Why it evolves into various different forms is unknown. One cannot tell from a Wurmple's appearance which form it will take when it evolves.
pokecraft.species.wurmple.name: Wurmple
pokecraft.species.wynaut.desc: It tends to move in a pack with others. They cluster in a tight group to sleep in a cave.
pokecraft.species.wynaut.name: Wynaut
pokecraft.species.wyrdeer.desc: The black orbs shine with an uncanny light when the Pokémon is erecting invisible barriers. The fur shed from its beard retains heat well and is a highly useful material for winter clothing.
pokecraft.species.wyrdeer.name: Wyrdeer
pokecraft.species.xatu.desc: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun’s movement all day.
pokecraft.species.xatu.name: Xatu
pokecraft.species.xerneas.desc: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
pokecraft.species.xerneas.name: Xerneas
pokecraft.species.xurkitree.desc: They’ve been dubbed Ultra Beasts. Some of them stand unmoving, like trees, with their arms and legs stuck into the ground.
pokecraft.species.xurkitree.name: Xurkitree
pokecraft.species.yamask.desc: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
pokecraft.species.yamask.name: Yamask
pokecraft.species.yamper.desc: This gluttonous Pokémon only assists people with their work because it wants treats. As it runs, it crackles with electricity.
pokecraft.species.yamper.name: Yamper
pokecraft.species.yanma.desc: Its frail wings are so thin that one can see clear through them. However, during flight these wings exhibit the power to churn air with force enough to launch a house skyward.
pokecraft.species.yanma.name: Yanma
pokecraft.species.yanmega.desc: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
pokecraft.species.yanmega.name: Yanmega
pokecraft.species.yungoos.desc: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
pokecraft.species.yungoos.name: Yungoos
pokecraft.species.yveltal.desc: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
pokecraft.species.yveltal.name: Yveltal
pokecraft.species.zacian.desc: This Pokémon has slumbered for many years. Some say it’s Zamazenta’s elder sister—others say the two Pokémon are rivals.
pokecraft.species.zacian.name: Zacian
pokecraft.species.zamazenta.desc: This Pokémon slept for aeons while in the form of a statue. It was asleep for so long, people forgot that it ever existed.
pokecraft.species.zamazenta.name: Zamazenta
pokecraft.species.zangoose.desc: Zangoose usually stays on all fours, but when angered, it gets up on its hind legs and extends its claws. This Pokémon shares a bitter rivalry with Seviper that dates back over generations.
pokecraft.species.zangoose.name: Zangoose
pokecraft.species.zapdos.desc: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon. It’s said that when Zapdos rubs its feathers together, lightning will fall immediately after.
pokecraft.species.zapdos.name: Zapdos
pokecraft.species.zarude.desc: Once the vines on Zarude’s body tear off, they become nutrients in the soil. This helps the plants of the forest grow.
pokecraft.species.zarude.name: Zarude
pokecraft.species.zebstrika.desc: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
pokecraft.species.zebstrika.name: Zebstrika
pokecraft.species.zekrom.desc: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.
pokecraft.species.zekrom.name: Zekrom
pokecraft.species.zeraora.desc: Electricity sparks from the pads on its limbs. Wherever Zeraora runs, lightning flashes and thunder echoes.
pokecraft.species.zeraora.name: Zeraora
pokecraft.species.zigzagoon.desc: Zigzagoon that adapted to regions outside Galar acquired this appearance. If you’ve lost something, this Pokémon can likely find it.
pokecraft.species.zigzagoon.name: Zigzagoon
pokecraft.species.zoroark.desc: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
pokecraft.species.zoroark.name: Zoroark
pokecraft.species.zorua.desc: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
pokecraft.species.zorua.name: Zorua
pokecraft.species.zubat.desc: Makes its home in gloomy caves. Atrophied eyes have left this Pokémon blind, so it scans its surroundings via sound waves that it emits from its mouth as it flies.
pokecraft.species.zubat.name: Zubat
pokecraft.species.zweilous.desc: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
pokecraft.species.zweilous.name: Zweilous
pokecraft.species.zygarde.desc: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
pokecraft.species.zygarde.name: Zygarde
